c74object.name: fl.nexttime~
c74object.digest: Stores times for a connected recursive scheduler
c74object.description: The first input takes single values (time till next frame). The second input needs to be connected directly to the scheduler.

objarg.name: [stream-specifier]
objarg.description: Optionally, the first argument may be used to explicitly specify the number of streams. This is done using a symbol starting with the character = followed by the required number of streams (without a space). For example, an argument of =4 will set the number of streams to 4.

method.name: info
method.description:
Print info about fl.nexttime~ to the max window for reference purposes. If no arguments are provided then all information is posted to the Max window. Else a set of flags is used to select which sections of the reference to display, and whether or not the information should be provided in a shortened form.
The following flags are available:
description - display the object description.inputs - display info on inputs.outputs - display info on outputs.io - display info on both inputs and outputs.parameters - display info on the object parameters.quick - display shorten versions of any info displayed.

method.name: frame
method.description: Used internally by FrameLib's connection routines. User messages have no effect.

method.name: sync
method.description: Used internally by FrameLib's connection routines. User messages have no effect.

attribute.name: rt
attribute.description:
Sets the realtime state for fl.nexttime~. When set to 0 fl.nexttime~ forms part of a non-realtime network for performing offline processing in Max message threads. This mode of operation uses buffer~ objects for audio IO.
More info on non-realtime processing with FrameLib can be found in Tutorial 11.

attribute.name: id
attribute.description:
Sets the context name for fl.nexttime~ in order to determine distinct processing contexts.
More info on FrameLib contexts can be found in Tutorial 10.
